items.title: Bayesian optimized parameter selection for density-based clustering applied to single molecule localization microscopy
items.author: Laura J. Kaufman
items.content: Bayesian optimized parameter selection for density-based clustering algorithms accurately and efficiently selects unbiased parameters for clustering of single molecule localization microscopy data.

items.title: Neurocomputational mechanisms of personal benefits and justifications in moral decision-making
items.author: Gabriele Bellucci
items.content: Computational modeling provides insight into how individuals weigh rewards and evidence during moral decision-making, and the role of anterior insula and anterior cingulate cortex in this trade-off.

items.title: Synergistic optimization enhancing the precision and efficiency of cytosine base editors in poplar
items.author: Hai Lu
items.content: A base editing study in poplar shows that synergistic optimization of a cytosine base editing system (hyPopCBE-V4) enhances C to T editing efficiency and precision, reduces byproducts, and yields herbicide-resistant germplasm, providing a tool for tree breeding.

items.title: Multi-omics analysis of canine aging markers and evaluation of stem cell intervention
items.author: Jinlian Hua
items.content: Multi-omics analysis of canine aging uncovers aging-related cell populations & markers, identifies Penitrem A & UDP-N-acetylglucosamine as metabolic hallmarks, & demonstrates MSCs overexpressing NMNAT1 can delay or reverse aging in dogs.

items.title: Structure of a stripped-down and tuned-up far-red phycobilisome
items.author: A. William Rutherford
items.content: CryoEM structure of far-red light adapted allophycocyanin unveils evolutionary adaptations for far-red light photosynthesis and the molecular strategies for efficient light-harvesting under far-red light.

items.title: GPCR kinases phosphorylate GPCR C-terminal peptides in a hierarchical manner
items.author: Alvar D. Gossert
items.content: The investigation of GPCR C-terminal phosphorylation reveals inherent specificity of GRKs. The time-resolved NMR data hint at the possibility of time-dependent downstream signaling.

items.title: Pore formation by the CDTb component of the Clostridioides difficile binary toxin is Ca2+-dependent
items.author: David J. Weber
items.content: Calcium-dependent conformational exchange in the cell-binding component of the C. difficile binary toxin triggers its membrane insertion in contrast to other bacterial translocases that are pH sensitive.

items.title: The characterization of Klebsiella pneumoniae associated with neonatal sepsis in low- and middle-income countries to inform vaccine design
items.author: Francesca Micoli
items.content: A potential correlation between polysaccharide structural features and the ability of corresponding antibodies to bind and kill in vitro a large panel of Klebsiella pneumoniae clinical isolates, supporting the development of a multivalent vaccine.
